column3: News;A car bomb attack has killed at least three Malian civilians and wounded two others in northern Mali
column4: the country’s security ministry says.------“A loaded 4×4 vehicle exploded in the vicinity of a residential complex” in the city of Gao at around 8:00 pm (2000 GMT) on Monday
column5: the ministry said in a statement.------The blast also damaged surrounding houses.------A Western diplomatic source separately told AFP that four foreigners working for a United Nations (UN)-contracted mine-clearing operation had been injured in the attack.------“Two Cambodians
column7: and a Zimbabwean working for an organization subcontracted by UNMAS (the UN’s mine-clearing operation) were wounded on Monday in a terrorist attack in Gao
column8: ” the source said.------The attack was claimed by a group allied with al-Qaeda.------Mali has been in turmoil since Tuareg rebels and loosely-allied militants — some of them with links to al-Qaeda — took over the desert north in 2012. French forces intervened the following year to allegedly fight back the militants------But the militants have since regrouped and now regularly launch attacks on civilians
column10: and international missions.------Mali’s security ministry said Malian and international forces had been mobilized in the wake of the Monday attack.------The explosion came as French Defense Minister Florence Parly and German Defense Minister Ursula von der Leyen met in the Malian capital of Bamako on Monday to discuss a planned five-nation anti-terror force for the Sahel region.------*The injured Cambodians were civilian contractors
